text: Sample at MBCC. Pours black. Aroma is roasted, malty, bourbon, woody. Taste is balanced, roasty, malts, slight, coffee.
Tap at TCBW. Pours black. Aroma is sweet, smoke, roast, barrel. Flavor is sweet and bitter, chocolate, roast, smoke. Overall: very good.

Draught at Fermentoren. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with roasted malts, nuts, smoke, dark fruits, licorice, chocolate and coffee. Bitter finish with roasted malts, dark fruits, smoke, coffee, licorice, chocolate and nuts. Excellent imperial stout.

Tap @TCBW 2017. Almost pitch black color. Small size, beige head, stays. Smoked, woody, roast, malty and sausages in aroma. Smoked, woody, sausages and malty in taste. Alcohol is kind of covered. Solid brew.

Tap at Tallinn Craft Beer Weekend 2017. Day 2.


Black stuff with a beautiful tan head. Sweet, choco, coffee, hops, good.

330ml brown bottle. Black colour, thin ring of brown foam, some light lacing in the glass. Nose - dark chocolate and choclate syrup, molasses, roast and mild bacony smoke. In the mouth the beer has notes of dark chocolate, chocolate syrup, bitter roast, brown sugar, weak smoky undertones. Quite bitter with a long chocolaty and earthen after taste. Lighter bodied than expected, could be smokier and a touch more complex. Enjoyable. RE RATING NOTES: smoke comes out a lot more as this warms, it seems I was a little hasty on first taste...
Tap at mbcc17, copenhagen. Black color, tanned head. Aroma has lots of smoke, some coffee notes. Taste is smoke bomb, some wheat, burnt wood.

Tap at MBCC 2017. Pours black with brown lace. Roasted, coffee, chocolate. Slightly harsh after taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
TCBW 2017. Slight roast. Smoked... I donÂ’t like this hey. Bread. Burnt wood. Some chocolate maybe if IÂ’ll imagine hard.
Tap at TCBW. Dark brown beer, small beige head. Nose is mild smoke, roast, malt, mild fatty notes, nutty dryness. Flavor is smoke overtones on roast, malt, grapefruity hops. Oily mouthfeel. Not bad.

Dark brown colour with minimal head. Aroma has weird banana, maybe wheat, roasted malts, maybe even ice cream, dunno. Weird aroma. Taste is dry with roasted malts, espresso coffee, dark chocolate, licorice and dry ending. Some dark chocolate is sweetening but more dry. Fullish body and medium carbonation.

Thanks to wombat23, I think. Pours black from the bottle. The brown head is of short duration. Has a sort of impenetrable and inert look to it. Aroma is chocolate, old wood, ink, booze. This may be labelled a "smoked" beer, but IÂ’m failing to catch the aroma. Taste is bitter with a mild sour note going into the finish. Noticeable chocolate. Finish is warming and very boozy. The brew is not quite successful in hiding the 10% ABV that it brings, which in my book is a flaw. Body is fairly heavy. Overall, kind of good in a harsh, punishing sort of way, but lacking nuance or any real reason to come back to this.

Bottled. Pours clear deep brown with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, molasses, wood and smoked notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and slightly bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Shared 12 oz. bottle. Pours black with a tan head. Moderate to heavy lacing. Aroma of roasted malt, smoke notes. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, heavy oak, a bit of smoke, dark fruits. Finish is a bit harsh, the ABV is noticeable. Might be better classified in the Imp. Stout category rather than smoked. Still, a solid offering.

Aroma: heavily malty and lightly smoky; Appearance: pitch black with creamy tan head that dissipates slowly; Taste: oaky, woody and smoky; Palate: heavy body with long, boozy finish; Overall: good, especially for a smoked style.

Bottle. It pours completely black with a brown head. The aroma is deep roasted with notes of smoke, chocolate, ripe fruit and oak. Some tar. Creamy palate. The flavor is medium smoked and deep roasted. Light chocolate and tar. Oak and a whiff of coffee. Complex and tasty.

Sooo black and thick, quick mocha head. Nose is okay smoked molasses. Bittersweet is an understatement. Middle is a ladle of blackened sweet smoked malt, cherries and currants, woody hops. Finish is once again Bittersweet and long.

Thick, black colored, small non lasting tan head. Aroma is of dark fruits, roasted malt, dark chocolate, oats, some smoke and wood, coffee. Taste is very sweet malt, dark chocolate, dark fruits, roasted malt, oat, some smoked and woody notes, medium roasty coffee bitterness, some alcohol and warmth. Full bodied, thick and creamy, soft carbonation. Very nice!
(bottle, Bierhalle Deconinck, Vichte)

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, liquorice, chocolate, molasses, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a large dark brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, liquorice chocolate, molasses and mocha; ends slightly/medium bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. Would not say this is a Smoked; it feels much more like a smoked Imperial Stout. It feels like its always there, but never quite reaches the surface. The roasted malts are up there aplenty however. The aroma could have been stronger and the palate thicker though, but otherwise this beer is amazing.

355ml bottle pours black in color with a finger and a half of light brown head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is smoky with roasted grains and chocolate. Taste is smoky with a roasted grain bitterness and a chocolate malty sweetness. Medium to full bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, a nice brew which is quite complex and flavorful. Recommended.

Bottle from TidensFarver, Aarhus. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, coffee, dark chocolate, caramel, smoked notes. Full body. Soft carbonation. Oily texture. Nice roasted finish.

The aroma of oak barrels, soy, dark coffee, dark chocolate and licorice. The taste is similar with a lot of dark chocolate and coffee. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Really good and enjoyable beer. Follow me @ Kung av Ã¶l @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Not much smoke, a lot of booze, heavy coffee, a bit of chocolate..this beer has potential, but it seems very raw and not well put together. Probably a good candidate for the cellar.

Poured from bottle. Black with thick head but it disappeared quickly. Aroma has sweet malt, dark fruit and a whiff of smoke. Tastes sweet, coffee, chocolate and some smoke. Dried fruit and smoke dominate the aftertaste. Full body. Nice beer.

Bottle at Jester King Funk n Sour. Pours black with small tan head that diminishes quickly. The aroma is strong smoke, roasted malt, chocolate, dark fruit. Medium body, wood, roast, dark chocolate, toffee, dry finish, very good.

24-DEC-2016, bottle @home, from Boxbeers.
Black with a low tan head.
Aroma is roasted with chocolate and molases.
Taste has a Little smoke. Just enough to make it more interesting. Medium+ body, dry. Nice.

Na kranie w Beer Temple Amsterdam: Piwo nieprzejrzyste w kolorze czarnym z ladna bezowa aczkolwiek niezbyt trwala piana. W aromacie palone slody, lukrecja i intensywna czekolada. W smaku mamy wszystko to samo plus kawowy finisz. W smaku dosc slodkie i gladkie, pelne cialo z goryczka na srednim poziomie i raczej niskim wysyceniem. Wedzonosc wychodzi raczej w postaci dymu z ogniska i nut ziemistych. Bardzo zlozone i fajnie skomponowane piwo.

Purchased at Bottles and Cans in Chicago, IL; enjoyed at home after the holidays on a cold night. Appearance is pitch black, looks very thick, nice dark tan head. Aroma is rich in chocolate and smoked malt, lightly hoppy, smells boozy. Taste is very nice, rich, large smoked malt profile, heavy on the chocolate. Overall very good stuff.

Mooi zwart bier met dikke mokkakleurige schuimkraag die echter snel wegebt. Licht rokerig aroma, mout, koffie. Mooie dikke volle smaak. Chocolade(mousse), espresso, koffiebonen, tabak, leer. Goeie bittere afdronk zonder ergens "over the top" te gaan. Alles zeer goed in balans. Prima bier !!

Backlog. Synchronizing with notes and Untappd.
Great oily and thick beer. Love the body on this one!

Pours an incredibly viscous-looking pitch black body with a fairly large, dark-brown head that unfortunately isnÂ’t that long-lived. Very strong aroma of dark roasted malt, dark caramel and dark chocolate, with strong coffee in the back. Intense flavour that follows the aroma, with some additional generic fruity notes. Moderate sweet taste with a pretty heavy bitter and everlasting finish. Full body, oily to creamy texture, soft carbonation. A fantastic imperial stout! But smoked? 
[35.5 cl bottle @ Heim, Oslo]

11.2 ounce bottle poured into a teku. The beer is a thick black with a khaki head of foam. Super meaty and smoky beer. Rich, bacony, smoky taste. Very savory. Thick mouthfeel. Big body and moderate carbonation.

Pours a pitch black color with brown head that quickly fades. Aroma is roasty and smoky, licorice notes, earth and caramel. Taste follows the aroma, syrup, ashes, smoke, roast, caramel, chocolate, coffee, molasses and licorice. Sweet aftertaste. Really complex and enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Pours pitch black with a smooth brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, licorice, earthy notes and syrup. Taste is smooth, slightly roasty and sweetish with some syrup, malts and earthiness. Finish is earthy and roasty with some licorice and malts. Quite earthy but tasty and balanced.
Pours opaque black with a beige head, aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malt, smoke, flavor of chocolate, coffee, roasted malt, acidity, medium bodied, very nice

The aroma is full of dark chocolate, coffee, wheat, earth, wood, smoke and roast. The color is pitch black. The taste is full of dark chocolate, coffee, wheat, earth, wood, smoke, roast, dried fruits and tar. A nice beer!

Draft @ CBC 2015. Pours a dark brown black color with a small off-white head. Has a roasted malty caramel aroma with weak smoky hints. Roasted malty caramel flavor with weak smoky hints. Has a roasted malty caramel finish.

From a 355ml bottle on 25/9/2016 (shared by Butz, with thanks). Pours close to black with a medium foamy tan head. The nose is mild smoke and chocolate malt. Taste wise, itÂ’s quite sweet and dessert like - lots of chocolate and caramel, a hint of toffee, some soy, finished off by a good dash of campfire smoke, and a hint of alcohol. Has a moderate roasty, hoppy bitterness. The palate is rih and velvety. A very, very good smoky impy.

Draft sample at Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 03.07.2016. Pour it dark color with small white head. Aroma dark chocolate, some roasted malts, earthy, smoke. Taste sweet roasted malty feel, dark chocolate, some smoked notes, little bit molasses, pretty much dry finish, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation. Interesting.

Tarnished brown-black with a frothy light tan head. Aromas of roasted malts, bitter chocolate, treacle and lightly smoked nuts develop. Fine carbonation rather slick and full bodied. Short malt sweetness quickly surpassed by roasty bitterness. Lasting for a good while on the palate drying out at the back end.
@Beertemple, zwart met mooie kaki kraag. Aroma can mout, cacao, chocolade, geroosterd, gebrand, smaken evenzo, vanille, super, dik, smooth, hout, gerookte mout, lekker

ASPETTO: nerissimo impenetrabile, schiuma marrone scuro, finissima, abbondante e decisamente persistente. AROMA: affumicato, legno, tanto tostato, caffÃ©, cacao amaro, liquoroso, zucchero caramellato. GUSTO: tutti i sentori avvertiti al naso, e in grande intensitÃ , con in piÃ¹ anche la liquirizia. CaffÃ¨ e liquoroso predominanti. Anche legnoso, e legno bruciato. Corpo decisamente strutturato e oleoso. Carbonizzazione abbastanza bassa. Capolavoro di birra!

Bittle (viking grace). Black. Dry oaky smokey roasted barley on nose. Pretty intense, slight ashy actually. Full bodied, smooth, thick, intense flavoured. Really roasty, malty porridgely. Clean finish. A really thick intense roasty stout. Theres smokyness, oak there too, but gets drawn into that general roastyness, dont seem to me like a special smoked nor oaked beer in that sense, its the roasty imperial stoutness that defines it primarly.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Draft. A brown beer with a tan head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, leading to a dry finish.
On tap. Black colour with beige head. Chocolate and coffee aroma. Sweet, chocolate, coffee, roasted taste. Medium to full body.

Tap at Beer Temple, 28th July 16. Pours rich, slick, black, slight head. Aroma is complex, smoke, leather, chocolate. Taste is multi layered, kind of a smoked imperial stout, smoke, bacon, leather, wood. Really excellent
RBESG 2016 in Barcelona. On tap at the Garage. Black colour. Very malty aroma and flavour, a bit unfresh, too moderate hops. Not much smoke though. Did not blow my socks off this one.

Beautiful brown/black with an inch of cocoa colored speckled head. Aroma is deep cocoa, some treacle, and a little dark fruit. Taste is mostly the same, but a touch overly woody, and an astringent mole asses twang with smokey phenolics into the finish. $4/12oz

Black colour, beautiful brown head. Aroma of smoke, dark chocolate, soy sauce. Taste is light to medium bitter, light sweet. Medium to full body, creamy texture, soft carbonation. Pretty nice and complex.

9th July 2016: on-tap at the Garage Brewpub with the RBESG guys. Another beer a long way from home on holiday in Barcelona. Poured black with a decent beige topping. Earthy, woody and boozy with some dark chocolate notes everywhere, no smokiness detected by me. Not sure if I have ever had an Â’oak aged, smoked imperial wheat stoutÂ’ before: but I liked this one.

Black pour with a slight light brown head. Sweet chocolate assertions with slight smoky/earthy notes. Palette is think and smooth. Very pleasing. Taste is rich with chocolate and molasses with a solid smoky slightly bitter finish that lasts. Good drinking.
Tap at La Garage. Black with light brown head. Coffee, blackberries, cocoa beans, brandy, cognac. Over medium sweet with boozy bitterness. Almost full bodied. Bit too boozy for me.

Putting this in smoked rather than imperial stout is really cheating.

Bottle from Last Drop. I donÂ’t drink a lot of imperial stouts, but I am interested enough in what Stillwater and intrigued enough by the smoke to consider this worth trying. Dark pour, limited head. Nice imperial stout base with plenty of power but very little ash, not overhopped, and no excess sweetness. Relatively subtle smoke behind all of that adding gentle interest. House character to the yeast. Alcohol completely hidden, easy to drink other than the rich flavor and thick texture. Very enjoyable.

AP: black, black foam
F: smoked sausages, peaty, dark chocolate, melas, white sugary, sweet Finish liqurice

On tap at OIBFÂ’16. Black colour, beige-brown head. Aroma of hard-roasted malts, some veggies, alcohol, light smoke. Flavour is roasted malts, liqourice, salmiak, light ashy, dry, some spirit, bitter finish. Medium bodied. Expected more.

tap @ OIBF 2016. zwart met volle bruine kraag. Aroma is vooral geroosterd met een kleine hint van rook. Mooie volle smaakbeleving met salmiak drop en een zagerij ook donkere chocolade is vol aanwezig. Zeker aan de droge kant maar een fantastische bier.

Tap @ OIBF Â’16 with Zlotta & Markoijelena. Black color. Dense light brown head. AromaÂ’s: some smoke, leather, fruit. Retronasal: smoke, leather, sweetish. Flavor is moderate sweet, moderate to full bitter, smoky. Medium bodied. Long finish with leather, bitterness, smoke. Nice one.

From tap at Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, mild smoke, Â’salmiakÂ’ liqourice, touch of coffee. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to medium bitter. Good full body. Tasty Imperial Stout with a mild touch of smoke, which is the way I prefer my smoke.

Sampled from tap at the Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Pitch black with a light brown head. Sweetish-malty, slightly roasty and a little smoky aroma of caramel, dark chocolate, sweet coffee and a touch of tar. Sweet, slightly roasty-malty and slightly smoky taste of dark chocolate, caramel, some coffee and hints of tar, followed by a medium long, rather roasty-bitter finish. Medium to full body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Nice!

On tap @ Oedipus Int. Beer Festival 2016. Nose is roasted malt, light smoke. Body is pitch black, head is small, brown, creamy, mostly diminishing, good lacing. Aroma is toast, licorice, roasted malt, old wood, dark dusty coffee. Light sweet, heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting roasty heavy bitter, later rather hoppy bitter, alcohol is hardly noticeable. Full body, dusty oily texture, soft carbonation. Quite heavy, strong flavor, great one.
This is a good stout. Smokey flavors. ItÂ’s bold. Dark chocolate, caramel, roasted malts. It feels heavier and potent but the flavors comes together really well. No alcohol comes through.

Pours syrupy black with brown head. Aroma of rich dark chocolate, mocha and toffee. Very robust flavour but silky smooth as it goes down. Great iStout. A bit more bitter and robust than the best examples

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Negro opaco y espuma beis. Aromas de chocolate, tostados, ahumados, vainilla, fruto rojo. Cuerpo denso y melsoso, con sabor de chocolate, ahumados y final de amargor quemado intenso con trago cÃ¡lido.

Looks great in jet black with a creamy head. ThereÂ’s a strange grassy note to the aroma and flavour that slightly detracts from the overall taste. ThereÂ’s barely any smoke. Good but not quite there.

Pours a viscous black with a dense, tan head. Nose is coffee, chocolate, vanilla, light, sweet smoke, vegemite, tobacco. Flavor is dark fruits, cocoa, molasses, spiced rum, vanilla, fragrant smoke, slightly grainy and wheaty, charcoal. Heavy, thick, syrupy body with lowish carbonation. Lovely and rich, velvety textured, wonderful as always from these guys!
Black pour with a big beige head. Roasty, dark chocolate, leather aromas. Taste is mocha, slightly smoky, roasty, burnt brown sugar and a little vanilla. Delicious.

I waited 15 months from the bottling date to open my last bottle of Surround and the wait was worth it. The pour is beautiful with long-lasting lacing. The aroma smokiness has pleasantly subsided from the hard slap when the bottles were newer so that the chocolate plays a role, too. The taste is layered, some sweet and more mildly bitter, dry and oaky. Lesser-aged bottles were aggressively bitter and uncharacteristic for a smoked stout. This one I like very much.

I think DuClaw effed up my taste buds. This beer tastes angry. IÂ’m getting angry drinking it. Burnt. Bitter. Too sweet. ItÂ’s fun to make something different and unusual, but you gotta pause and ask us that enough? In this case the answer is no.

On tap at CBC 16 Green Session. Pours a clear light yellow with a small white head. Dry and sour with aromas of sour fruits. Also notes of berries. Also some floral notes. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish.

355 ml bottle.
Pours jet black color with a large beige head. Dark malts, spices and roast on the nose, dark chocolate, wood and faint smoke, wheat is quite subtle. Dark chocolate, cocoa, subtle coffee and smoky wooden notes on the flavor, faint licorice, hints of coffee. Finish is spicy and malty, strong bitterness, alcohol comes slightly through at the end as a warming sensation. I like the smoky oaky aroma especially. Very complex, refined and heavy IS. Excellent.
3525

Bottle @ home via rot box. Deep brown appearance with a creamy, full, dark brown head. Burnt wood, oak, roasted chocolate, smoke, and ash in the nose. Full body, not overly sweet, moderate high bitterness. Scotch whisky, pine, burnt organic flavor. Not very boozy. Thick and flavorful like molasses. The flavor doesnÂ’t coat the mouth like some gooey, smoked beers. Plenty of pine and roast and char on the finish. Pretty solid brew.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into a glass. Black with medium light brown head. Aroma is dark malt, medium/thick body, medium carbonation, and thick small-bubble lacing. Taste is dark malt, a little smoke, anise, and some wood. Pretty heavy, not that much smoke.  More of an imperial stout than a smoked beer.

330 ml bottle from Embassy. Smokey aroma. Medium body. Above average carbonation for imperial stout. Big flavours of toasted sugars and malt. Bitter chocolate present. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle courtesy of cgarvieuk dregs run. Pours opaque black. Aromas of black pepper, coffee grind, chilli chocolate. Dry and full bodied, palate follows nose, big flavour.

Bottle thanks to cgarvieuk dregs run. 
Appearance - opaque black and oily in texture. 
Nose - smoke, liquorice and dark chocolate. 
Taste - tonnes of smoke. Chocolate at the back. 
Palate - close to medium bodied with a long dry smoky finish. 
Overall - really tasty.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of smoke, dark fruit. Taste is smoky, light lick of salt. Sweet, smoky finish.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2016 Bottle at craig?s. Pours black, nose is smoky, toffee, chocolate, taste is similar, salty, bitter. 3.8
Keg at the beer temple. Pours black, nose is liquorice, wood, chocolate, taste is sweet, rich chocolate, dry finish .4

Bottle. Pours black with a half inch of khaki foam. leaves a lot of lacing in the glass. Nice smoked notes on the nose. lots of smoke on the tongue along with a solid roasted malt thing. Hides its booze. finished clean. Solid beer.

Very smoky roasty aroma like a barbecue pit. IÂ’m also getting some dark fruit, oak and slight booze. Beautiful jet black color with a light brown head. Taste is roast and smoke forward, with some hop bitterness at the end and in the aftertaste. It reminds me of a more smoky Bells Expedition Stout. Has a salty characteristic that I didnÂ’t really care for. Somewhat lacking in palate; I could have used something more substantial. Overall this is a strong offering from Stillwater. The taste stays with you well after youÂ’re finished with it, kind of like a cigar.

Pours an opaque brownish black from the bottle with thin bubbly tan head. Aroma of hint of smoke over huge roasty chocolate malts, hint of fruity english yeast. Taste is more toward the smoke, stout tastes like the evil twin jesus almost, boozy but not over the top. Really nice stuff.

Bottle. Thick black pour produces a medium sized dark brown head with good retention and lace. Nose has roasted malt, fudge, chocolate, mild smoke. Flavour has charcoal, roasted malt, fudge, chocolate, brown sugar, vanilla. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, sweet with bitterness to match. Bitter finish with roasted malt. Rounded and not too rough, more a regular imperial stout than smoked, I think.
Bottle into a pint glass. Pours jet black with a small brown head. Nose is coffee,cocoa, and wood, with a hint of smoke. Taste follows. A massive stout loaded with flavor. Quite good.

This surprised the hell out of me. Looked great on the pour, not much on the nose but holy hell this has some taste. Bitter dark chocolate, coffee, some earth and oak in there too. Smokey on the finish. Great beer for a good price

Atlanta, Ga. - Hop City - Krog St Market - 12 oz bottle. Pours a deep dark motor oil-like black with a sticky but thin mocha colored head. light lacing. Pleasant smoky, meaty aroma with hints of smoked sausage, some light band-aids. Bold flavor with plenty of smoky goodness, some sweet barbecue sauce, smoked ham, light chocolate filters through the smoke. Pleasantly thick, creamy mouthfeel. Excellent.

12 oz bottle. Black in color with a small chocolate brown head. Aroma is of booze, prune, molasses, dark chocolate, hot fudge. Taste is of smoke, dark chocolate, coffee, fudge, roasted malts, molasses and some dark fruits.

Pour is a motor oil black with a large tan head. Aroma is a slight smoke with a sweet sugary molasses. Flavor is a nice char malt with some bakers chcocolate type sweetness. Finish leaves a nice roasted malt on the tongue. Not much smoke in this beer but it does have a nice dry and bitter roasted malt with no alcohol presence.
Bottle. Black pour. Smooth aroma of smoke, bacon, roasted malt and chocolate. Taste of smokey ham, mild licorice, roasted malt, creamy chocolate and some bitters in the finish. Good stuff.

Pours black with a large dark tan head.
Nose shows vanilla, smoke, light musty notes, heavy roast and some booze.
Flavours include aggressive roast, smoke and booze. Abrasively bitter.
UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 I really donÂ’t know why there arenÂ’t more smoked stouts around. Smoke compliments the chocolate and roasted coffee well while adding terrific texture.

Bottle. Black with a sticky medium brown head. Huge smoky aroma, wheat, dark chocolate, dark roast coffee and tobacco. Medium molasses sweetness with a big dry coffee bitterness. Heavier body with sticky feel.

Bottle. Black with an inch of brown head that fades to a coat. Aroma of molasses, medium roast, soy sauce, mocha, an odd ripe banana note. Smooth, luscious, lowish carbonation. Very sweet with rather moderate roasted flavours. Maybe thereÂ’s a wisp of smoke, but only maybe. Gently dries out toward the end. Lowish bitterness. Alcohol is very well hidden. some singed flavours emerge after a while and the mocha tightens to mainly dark chocolate. Pretty good stout.

Pours deep black like an oil slick with a crispy tan head that fades rapidly to a rim. Aroma is coffee and cocoa with a touch of smoke that comes out with warming. First hit on the palate is that smokiness but middled but some nice bitter coffee and sweet cocoa - even a note of cherry. Finish is oakey and smokey. I really like this unique beer.

12 oz bottle served in a goblet. 

A: Dark brown body is viscose and opaque. ItÂ’s topped with a mocha colored head that has decent retention and leaves ample lacing.

Aroma: dark roasted grains with hints of charred hardwood, toffee and black licorice.

Flavor: strong dark roasted grains with some coffee, dark chocolate and charred wood. 

Mouthfeel: Thick, very full body; medium carbonation. 

Overall: exceptionally strong flavors of very dark roasted grains with some charred wood notes.

Draught @ StagÂ’s Head. Inky black with small foamy beige head, faint mocha aroma, medium carbonation, mocha taste with alcohol undertones, thin body, long bitter mocha finish. Strong alcohol aroma, bitter but smooth brew.

Bottle. Pours a thick and oily midnight black with a huge dense dark coffee tan head that refuses to go away. Big heavy roast, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, smoke, and plums. Medium bodied, big roast, cocoa, chocolate, coffee. Alcohol does pop up a bit towards the end, but well hidden and very round for the size. Smooth roast and cocoa into the finish, chocolate and coffee with a dusty smokiness. Gorgeous.
Lighter than expected earthy and smoke aromas. Pours black, minimal head. Medium bitterness, light body but long finish. Earthy taste but not at all overpowering. Nice on a cold night.

Bottle. Pours inky black with brown head. Mild aroma is acidic with notes of fruit and a bit of chocolate. Intense roast malt character opens the flavor. Develops into smoky flavors that are not overpowering, and complement the roast character well. Warming, slightly bitter finish. Rich mouthfeel, full body. Flavorful stout, full of character, lacking in aroma.

Bottle from Meditrina. Black with dense and thick brown head and lace. Mild smoke earth bubblegum wood chocolate booze aroma. Woody earthy dark chocolate sweetness with molasses and dark fruit mild wheat tang booze and woody bitterness with lingering smoke. Rich as Donald TrumpÂ’s ex-wives. Smooth as ObamaÂ’s lies. Holy fuck. Excellent. Drink it with a spoon.

Dark tan head dark pour medium carbonation aromas molasses caramel grain chocolate rich fruit ash the flavours roast chocolate ash woody note dry cocoa wheat is well perfected rich toasted like vanilla the oak so good on the palate stone fruits medium bitter taste very easy drinking the finish best notes oak dark malts fruit notes lasting sweetness good stuff
Black. Light aroma.but good dark malts. Chocolate. Roast.deeply complex but simple

Weird disconnect between the smell and taste. Smells like coffee and banana, plus notes of blueberry. Taste, however, is woody, dry, and only hint of fruit or sweetness. Lots of roasty flavors, too. Odd, but enjoyable.

Bottle. Dark dark midnight look. Thick tan head. The smell is chocolate, cigarettes, ashy, muddy, dessert, wheat, burnt, boggy. The taste is similar, sort of like licking an ashtray. Maybe I will try that sometime because this ainÂ’t bad.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Thin creamy tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Nice smokey taste. Well hidden alcohol

Draught @ CBC2015. Pours pretty much pitch black with a creamy mocha head that leaves some sticky lacing and trace on the glass while dissiapting. Smell is malty, roasty and smokey with roasted malts, sweet dark bread, caramel, burnt wood, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, moist soil and hints of alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty and smokey. Mouthfeel is soft, round, slightly astringent, tiny boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, caramel, dark roast coffee, dark chocolate, peat, leather, moist soil and hints of alcohol. Ok impy with a decent smoke element. Good but fails to really take off.

Thick black body and beautiful brown head. Looks like espresso and also smells a bit like it. Roasted too, milk chocolate for sweetness. Buy hopped too, huge favour. We donÂ’t need no stinking barrel aging, this is the bomb. Almost too rich, as I was very slow to finish the bottle. Oh who am I kidding... ItÂ’s great stuff. (33cl bottle from QV.ID)

12oz bottle (JeffÂ’s recommendation - thanks!). Pours a super dark, completely opaque brown-black; a thin brown-white head leaves creamy lacing which does not fade. Strong aroma of wine and oak, a little malty sweetness and pungency on the nose.Taste features the same wine/oak characteristics with some chocolate and toffee notes. The malt backbone lasts nicely; mouthfeel balances some creaminess with an agreeable amount of carbonation. Darn tasty.

12oz bottle from Supermarket Liquor 
Pours thick black with a small white tan head, some lacing. Aroma is mild smokiness, dark malts and ashy. Flavors of dark malts, grainy, ashy, chocolate and leather

May 1, 2015. On tap at CBC2015, blue session. 
Black with a small brownish head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, smoke, ash, licorice, coffee and leather. Taste is light to medium sweet, roasted bitterness, some smoke notes. On tap @ All In Beer Fest 2015. Very dark brown with a tiny brown head. Malty and roasted tones. Malt, coffee, frruit and hops. Full body with a long bitter / roasted finish.

Bottle sample at SBWF15. Pitch black with tan head. Aroma is dark chocolate, roasted notes and sweet malt with some smoke hiding in the background. Taste is bitter dark chocolate, some coffee, smoked meats with a bitter finish
Tap @ All In Beer Fest, Gothenburg 151107. Roasted malty and smokey with dried fruits, medium body with a watery to oily texture. The finish is dry and roasted.

12 oz bottle - pours insanely dark with a thin dark brown head that laces my glass. Roasty, burnt biscuit aroma. Huge coating flavor in each sip - dark chocolate, peat, espresso, tar and charred wood.

Bottle, 13/11/15. Pours dark brown black, small head. Aroma is roasted, some wheat, salty liquorice, light coffee. Taste is salty liquorice, liquorice, some roast and coffee. Tad rough, rather one-sided.
On tap at All In Beer Fest. Malty smell with oak, smoke and dark malts. Similar taste. Sweet taste with some light metal. A bit rough but nice.

Sample at All in beer fest 2015. Black with tanned head. Smoky, peat smoke, toast, chocolate and dried fruit. Semi dry with medium carbonation.

Shared by Mick/Brian at the AQ Event at Qbrick. Stereo pours a beautiful pitch black with a tan head. The aroma is savoury dark chocolate. The taste is bitter, dark chocolate, savoury, a bit smokey. A solid Imperial Stout but at 1000 yen a snifter (1/2 pint or so) was too pricey for me to pull the trigger on - thanks for sharing guys.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours black with a dark tan head. Aroma is smoke, possibly some dark malt coming through. Full bodied. Flavor is smoky dark malt - but nothing like single malt - except intensity. Tastes really good.
Bottle from Corti Brothers. Pours dark brown with an attractive tan head and a smoky treacle aroma. There is a hearty dark molasses and chocolate flavor with a smoky finish.

Draught at a fucken supermarket. Opaque black liquid with small tan head. Aroma of licorice, smoke, leather, chocolate, biscuit, toast and port wine. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with notes of licorice, chocolate, smoke and toast. Medium to full bodied with medium carbonation. Pretty nice. Super weird drinking this, for 50 SEK at a bar in a supermarket.

Dark black with mahogany reddish head... Aroma of smoked malts, dark roasted malts, chocolate... Flavor is smoked malts, chocolate, roasted notes... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2016 12 oz. looks like it was bottled 1-13-2015. Jet black with a lasting disc of brown sugar foam on top. Nose is a melange of molasses, smoke and mocha. Tastes of molasses, char, smoked meat, soy and bakerÂ’s chocolate. Long finish shows the oak along with touches of blackberry and merlot. Heavy body has medium carbonation and a good balance with just a light bit of stickiness for such a big beer.

Appearance: pours with a medium dark tan head, the head has decent retention though, the beer is a very black opaque color
Aroma: coffee, chocolate, alcohol 
Taste: subdued sweetness, smokey, oak, has a strong coffee bitterness, 
Palate: very thick and heavy mouthfeel, bitter aftertaste, average carbonation 
Overall: this is a very big beer, has to be sipped slow, more bitter than sweet

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I could really get used to these guys with their high quality beer at a budget price. When I think of a double digit abv, sturdy robust smoked stout, I donÂ’t expect to be able to pay with coins I find under the seat of my car. Pours jet black with a coffee brown foam head. Big roasted malt aroma. Huge smoked malt flavor upnfront, robust, thick body to it. Creamy coffee, and a smokey finish. What a beer here, and for the price, itÂ’s damn near the best in its style.
Bottle from Dranken Geers. Dark brown colour, brown foam. Medium carbonation. Nose of ashes, roasted malts and coffee. Very dry and harsh bitter. Subtle nose of smoke. Ok beer.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Black with rich creamy beige head. Toasty chocolate and coffee aroma with some cherry brandy. Sweet with full body and rounded mouthfeel. Chocolate, caramel, brandy, licorice and pepper, notes of peat. Inky bitter finish. Rich, but somewhat distorted and oily. Functional, but not complex.

Bottle. Pours a deep brown/black with a dense tan head and lovely aromas of chocolate, peat, molasses, anise and a hint of oak(?). Flavor is nice and stouty with a little bit of a molasses edginess. It has an almost tannin like note to it, which pulls up just short of being a liability. Very solid offering.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 12oz bottle shared by Patrick. Rich, sweet, lots of depth. The wheat adds a nice touch. Viscous, but there is some bitterness to balance it out, maybe more on a bakerÂ’s chocolate level. A little bit of a specialty malt overload, but very well done, in line with a lot of Scandinavian stuff.
Tap at Marciero. Aroma is smoke, roast, little spicy. Taste has some sweetness, roasty again but not so much smoke.
Pours a jet black with a thin, long-lasting tan head. Aroma is oak, some smoke, and roast. Flavor is smoke, oak, bitter chocolate, and roast. Smooth with a full, chewy body. Delicious beer.

Pitch black color with dark brown head. Aroma has sweet dark malts, some coffee and a hint of dark fruits. Taste starts also a bit sweet and fruity but gets smoky, roasty and bitter to the finish. Aftertaste has roastiness, coffee notes and also a slight grassy hoppiness. Body is heavy and smooth with just the right amount of carbonation. Very complex and enjoyable imperial stout.

Draft at the world of beer in Denver. Pours deep black with a medium sized brown head. The aroma has big cocoa, some roasted malt, light coffee, a bit of milk chocolate. The taste has a big dark chocolate, roasted malt, a bit of a salted almond note. Very well done!!!

12oz bottle to muh belluh via a glass - Nose is smoke, roasted malts and milk chocolate. Great flavor with a rich dark chocolate bitter finish. For some reason I expected more smoke, but thatÂ’s on me, not the beer. No sign of booze in this 10% ABV concoction. Slight metallic aftertaste. Subtle smoke. Slightly boozier and sweeter as it warms. I am very glad to have tried this. I do foresee drinking this again, perhaps on a freezing camping trip. I would pair this with game, smoked meats, stinky cheeses, bacon-flavored anything. I am looking forward to the other smoked beer I picked up by Stillwater (vacuum something or other).
Tap at Marciero. black, cloudy, lovely brown head. Nose os wheat, light smoke, chocolate. Smoky, wheaty flavor, chocolate and caramel. Dry and woody. Nice.

The nose features light chocolate, coffee and touch of dankness. The smokiness is well blended into the taste profile, adding to bitter chocolate, cream, coffee, and a hint of earthy hops. There is a slightly bitter coffee aftertaste, but it works. Well done
Pitch black pour, nice brown head. Beautiful. Huge aroma of smoke, wood, chocolate. Flavor of dark chocolate, smoke, fruit. Full, chewy, roasty/chocolaty finish. Damn.
From tap at CBC 2015. Black with a brown head. Aroma and flavour of smokes, malt, caramel, chocolate, licorice and bitter.

On draught
Pours basically black with a good head and lots of lacing on the glass.

The aroma is lots of dark chocolate and light coffee with some roasty and smoky malt. ItÂ’s got a touch of licorice and a bit of chalk. 

The flavor is roasty and smoky with about as much licorice flavor as smoke flavor. ItÂ’s got some nice espresso, some woodiness, and a minimal but somewhat pronounced sweetness. ItÂ’s plenty bitter. 

I like it, but I fail to see how this is the highest rated of the series. huh

12 oz. bottle from The Hop Yard, Raleigh. Rich black pour with a short cinnamon brown head. Aroma of peat, smoke, chocolate, and dark fruit. The taste is smoky but it does not get in the way of the espresso, dark chocolate, raisin, licorice, oak, and Earth. This is more of an Imperial Stout than a smoked in my opinion but the smoked character is certainly noted. A great beer!

Tap at Watering Hole. Deep black pour with a medium-sized latte colored head. Big aromas of dark malt, chocolate and coffee with some smoke and bacon. Taste is similar with a nice creamy mouthfeel. Smooth coffee, coffee and roasted flavors on the palate. Nice bitter finish but not overly so.
Bottle at VictorÂ’s 5K. Pours black tan head. Nose/taste of bacon, smoke, chocolate and oak - medium body.
Bottle. Black pour with brown head. Smoke, roasted, chocolate aromas. Flavors are smoke, bacon, chocolate and roasted malt Flavors.
Nice smokiness, with a sort of mesquite character of light caramelized sweetness. Like someone tried to make the best beer in a style I donÂ’t adore and mostly succeeded.
Very decent smoked. Lacy. On tap at churchkey dc. Good drinkability. Bullseye the style.

12oz bottle pours with a viscous looking deep dark body that supports a near tight mocha colored head. Nice looking beer. The aroma offers up chocolate malts, malt balls, some dark roasted malts and a mild molasses sweetened spicy oak. The taste, oh my. This is smooth, supple, rich and deep and wonderful. ThereÂ’s a lot going on here but it is well integrated. I get molasses sweetened dark roasted malts, chocolate malts, a dash of burnt malts, a little marshmallow and then more chocolate. To midway a faint soft smokiness and a sliver of spicy oak bubble briefly to the surface. Into the finish the roasty to burnt malts grow amid a sea of chocolate goodness. As it warms the spicy oak grows. Terrific experience.

Smoke, toejam, coffee nose. Black thick viscous pour, the kind that just glugs out, thin beige head, nice lacing. Chocolate syrup initially, coffee at midpalate, smoke and charred oak finish. Full body, moderate carbonation. Really nice intensity and transitions.

Smells like a campfire after it is put out. Super dark black with very thin brown head. The smoke sits on your tounge with a light wheat backbone. The delicious chard taste sticks around long after the sip.

Cool retro-modern label. This is called an imperial wheat stout - is this all wheat malt? Slightly dank, sweet, chocolate cake aroma. Surprisingly dry and woody flavor. Charred wood chips, licorice, hops, some acidity. More than da little off balance, but a very powerful brew for sure.

12oz bottle. Pours dark brown/black with a creamy tan head. Notes of coffee and burnt caramel. Smoke flavors are very subtle and hardly noticable. Somewhat thin palate. This is good but doesnÂ’t match many of the other impy stouts out there.

Smells rich, roasted malt, molasses. Pours black with a dark brown head. Tastes starts with molasses, gingerbread like, rye bread, licorice, cloves, cola nut, caraway (there is a lot going on). Finish is dry, bitter, and very heavy, slightly spicy. 

Less sweet than I would have liked, the end is almost too bitter. There is a ton going in the packet, so kudos for making that interesting.
Aroma of coffee and espresso pours a dark brown color with a lasting tan well laced head. Delicious taste of coffee with hints of chocolate. Full bodied with a mildly bitter coffee funish.

Poured from a tap. Dark brown color, medium tan head. Light sour milk and chocolate malt aroma. Full body with a nice chocolate, wood and malt flavor with a creamy texture and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle:
Pours black...with a short, dark tan head.
Wood smoke, chocolate, dark fruit scent.
Flavour is a pronounced ashy bitter....coffee grounds, bitter chocolate roast.
Charred oak....
Very nice...burned and bitter.

Pours thick and black with a brown soft head. Smells o chocolates and coffee, light fruit and perfume. Taste is a smoky coffee chocolate. Perhaps a bit of licorice. Definite smoke - rubber tire. Delicious. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Lactic dark chocolate, malt, and smoky wood ash aroma. Oil black with moderate brown head. Sweet creamy/lightly smoky dark chocolate, coffee, malt, and moderately bitter herbal flavor. Nice body and good balance. Very tasty.

Pours black into a snifter. Mocha head with good retention recedes to skim surface. Dark chocolate, mild smoke and dried fruit aromas. Soft with dark chocolate and soy upfront turning to licorice before the lasting cocoa finish.

Purchased from Craft Beer Cellar last week. $7.49 for the 12 oz. bottle. To bulbous red wine glass, pours a umber-tinted inky and oily dark dark brown; edges of liquid resemble ancient cedar. Trim razor-thin off-white head 1 finger in length stood. Aromas of caramelized sea salt, oak, wheat grain, pipe tobacco, semi-sweet 69% dark chocolate, unripe cherries, lavender, and tangerine peels. Unexpectedly floral and fruity.Tastes much the same with the addition of sweat, spent grain, and farmhouse yeast. Strange, wordy concept. Came off profoundly stronger as an experimental black ipa.
Smoky malt strong at the start. Toast, cocoa, and a hint of coffee and char. Very bold, full, thinning out in the finish.

12 oz. bottle from Louisville Beer Store. Aroma: Very oaky and woody-type smoke; moderate dark chocolate and molasses; lightly sweet overall. Appearance: Viscous oily black pour with a bubbly mocha head that fades into a patchy skin. Flavor: Oak leads off and is followed by a woody, ashy smoke character; dark chocolate/molasses notes are next, and give a little sweetness to this otherwise dry beer; the finish is bitter and roasty. Palate: Full body, creamy texture, very soft carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: A very nice and big smokey stout.

Black color with a large head. Very strong oaky fire aroma. Dark cocoa flavor. Quite smoky, but the chocolate and roast overpower it. Oak is prominent. Slight graininess. Some molasses as it war,s. Dry, a bit bitter. Very full bodied.

Sampled from bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Opaque pitch black color, average sized dark brown head. Aroma is malts, dark malts, roast, some coffee. Tastes about the same: malts, quite firm roasted malts, bitter, lightly coffee, malt bitter and roast bitter. Medium body, medium to thick texture, suitable carbonation. Quite nice.

Bottle to snifter. Jet black pour with compact, two-finger, dark-sand head. Aroma of smoke, vanilla, cinnamon, molasses. Flavor is bitter dark chocolate, raisin, toasty, not too much alcohol warmth. More bitter and hi-carb I would expect from this style. A-ok.

[7103-20150304] Tap. Toasted woody peat aroma. Black brown cola body with a quick foamy tan head head. Roasted woody grains flavour. Full body. Good. (8/3/8/3/15) 3.7
(@ Birch & Barley, Washington, DC)

12 ounce bottle from Wine Warehouse. Dark brown, large foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of smoke, oak, roasted malt, chewy dark chocolate. The taste is smoke, oak, tobacco, coffee, roast. Thin bodied, mild booze, low carbonation.

Bottle. Pours opaque black with rich, tan head. Aroma is espresso, roasted malts, dark chocolate, light smoke, earthy notes, and faint dark fruit. Flavor is rich dark chocolate and heavy earthy bitterness with some black coffee roast character and faint smoke. Medium/full body.

Tap @CBC2015
Dark opaque color, small brownish head. Some toasted whiskey aroma in the nose. Medium-bodied. Bready, smokey, malty and alcoholic flavor.

Wow. ThatÂ’s a great beer! What a balance. Thick and creamy mouth feel. Easy to drink while the alcohol is perfectly hidden. A prouesse. I underestimated that drink and I had one of my best beer surprises lately. Bravo.
Bottle. Black beer with a brown head. Smoke and light malt aroma. Nice smoke and bacon flavor with caramel. Medium bodied. Smoke and caramel lingers with light spice.

CBC. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, smoke, liquorice and caramel. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, little liquorice, little smoke, meat, caramel, hop, medium sweet and a little bitter.
smooth powerful and complex. some roast some cocoa some vanilla and nice malt. a bit of licorice.

Sample at Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Thanks for sharing todayÂ’s beers!
APPEARANCE: dark brown beer, small head.
NOSE: caramel, fruity, sweet.
TASTE: caramel, fruity, sweet.

Pours a solid black with a brown head and lacing. It has a nice aroma of dark chocolate and some smoked malt. The flair is also dark chocolate and some light smokiness over a smooth, heavy body.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: very dark brown, with a huge, thick, creamy, chocolate milk colored head and decent lacing.  Aroma: 	smoke, bitter dark chocolate, chicory, light soy sauce, wood, vanilla, caramel.  Taste: as the aroma indicates. Finish: lingering dry roasty bittersweet chocolate; palate is rich and creamy. Notes: Pretty darn good. Bottle from Downtown Crown in Gaithersburg, Maryland.
CBC. Black with a brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, dark chocolate and smoked. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 010515

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours very dark brown with a creamy brown head, lacings. Aroma of roasted malt, caramel, wood, smoke, chocolate. Flavor of malt, wood, smoke, campfire, caremel, light alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, warming alcohol in the finish. 010515
Bottle. Motor oil pour with a medium mocha head. Aroma of fudge, char and molasses. Taste follows and adds some wood. Rich sticky mouthfeel. Booze is well hidden. Solid.

Imperial Wheat Stout? Holy Guacamole, gotta try it! OK: pours deep coffee sable with a very thick and rather persistent sepia head. Aroma has firm notes of molasses, chocolate, roast wheat and smoky wood with a hint of quality coffee. Bold flavor swirls notes of smoky wheat, molasses, quality coffee, chocolate and charcoal over the tongue in a delightful and subtly sweet sonata of tastes. Mouthfeel has firm and viscous body, and a fair bit of fizz, leaving a smoky and earthy finish. Surround this one with your tummy!

Keg at the 4th Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Session 2, 01/05/2015. 
Black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is dark fruit, rich roast, spice, chocolate.
Taste comprises charr, toffee, chocolate, dark malt, fruit rinds.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok but lacking in depth for the ABV, very subtle on the smoke.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle at Church Key, DC. Almost black in the glass, with a small tan head. Licorice, burnt malts, dark sugar and molasses in the aroma. Some prunes. ItÂ’s full bodied, warming and smooth on the palate, with a nice carbonation. Licorice, molasses, burnt malts and a nice hoppy bitterness in the rather sweet flavor. Lasting sweet finish with molasses, burnt malts, prune notes and some hops. A bit heavy all the way this one. 150620

Pitch black coloured body that shows oil all over, with a thick, luscious, five centimetre tall rich brown head - very nice looking. Aroma of smoke, soy sauce, mushrooms, earth, caramel and bunches of oatmeal. Full-bodied; Rich malty flavours with some earthy notes, caramel, mushrooms and soy sauce noticeable, all with a smoked overtone throughout. Aftertaste shows more of the same with a bit of bacon flavour, more oatmeal and some rye even, alongside chocolate and coffee. Overall, a nice rich beer, full of good flavours, but nothing groundbreaking nor worth searching out. I sampled this twelve ounce bottle purchased yesterday at Whole Foods (Bowery) in New York, New York for US$3,99 on 18-June-2015, sampled a day later in my hotel room on the LES of New York on 19-June-2015.

6/18/2015: Stillwater Contemporary Works Surround... Dark chocolate, cherrywood smoked caramelized malt, charred wood, and black strap molasses. Wow, pours out in a black color like used motor oil with a dense, pocked, brown-colored head gathering on the surface. The alcohol is mostly hidden. The flavor is roasty and dark, lots of caramelized malt and cocoa/unsweetened chocolate, with a dry, bitter finish that has a lot of smoke and char. Medium-full body, very smooth, slightly oily. This is really good and really big, but itÂ’s very subtle overall.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Opaque brown/black with a solid, three-finger brown head, heavy streaks of lace. Aroma of malt and chocolate. Taste is chewy dark chocolate and malt,...in that order. It moves from there to a swallow that turns to bitter chocolate and earth. A really big brew that is obviously high in abv, but is also balanced and satisfying.

Black pour with a frothy brown head. Faded to a thick collar. Big booming aroma full of dark cocoa, smoke, vanilla, melted candy bar. Yowzer. Flavors followed suit with lots of cocoa, vanilla, touch of smoke, marshmallow, lingering bitter finish, lots of roast. Mouthfeel was creamy and slick with moderate carbonation. Really impressed with the this one. Drank at close to room temp.

24/V/15 - 12Fl. Oz. bottle @ LIBF (Leuven) - BB: n/a (2015-698)  Thanks to the Belgian (and Dutch, and...) RB crew for sharing todayÂ’s beers!
Clear dark brown beer, creamy beige head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. aroma: some coffee, caramel, slightly smoky. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bitter, some dried fruits, dark chocolate, hoppy, some coffee. Aftertaste: bitter, hoppy, coffee, cocoa powder, very complex, like it!

Pours dark brown with a small tan head. The aroma has smoke, roast, wood, meatiness, molasses and lightly earthy hops. It has a medium / full body with mild carbonation. The flavor begins with earthy grainy wood, smoke, roast, spices, bright hops and mild meat. The finish has some char and smoke. Nice, odd and complex imperial stout.

Tasting at MattÂ’sBlack color with small brown head. Aroma of roasted malts, spices, and hints of leather (7.5). Good body strength; strong flavor of roasted malts with some coffee, light liquorice; not much of the expected smoke. A bit too roasty/burnt in the final.Nice beer.
Lots of oak woodiness. Smokey flavor. I dont think this beer knows what style it is. Dark black. Roasted. Thx vyvvy.

Sampled at GregÂ’s tasting. Almsot black. A blotchy tan head with a ring. This smells roasty and toasty. Interesting and nice. I taste coffee and chcolate. Spices and fruit. Smoke. Oranges. Complex, interesting, and smooth. I like it. Alcohol is nicely hidden.

Bottle. It poured a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and caramel. The taste was similar to the aroma with more malts, chocolate, coffee, smoke, caramel, wood and earthy bitterness. Nice.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, moderately acidic, lightly bitter.

Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt and earthy hop flavors; with a good roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and fairly full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and lightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is an awesome smoked imperial stout style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt and earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A very enjoyable offering.
